Thank you for making this inspirational video!  It is good to see another Sykora in the group.  I still travel a lot, and I have moved frequently in the last ten years.  This is another good way to experience new places, in greater depth.  In the last ten years, I have lived in three countries, including 12 locations in 8 towns and 4 US states.  I now plan to live long term in a single country, and maybe location, in central Europe and use the great public transportation system in the EU and surrounding countries to travel extensively.

Also a great safe place for travel is Japan! I did go with some friends but I did many alone excursions including walking around Kyoto very late at night. I never once felt unsafe. Plus the food there is amazing and the people are extremely nice! A lot of locals were interested in having a conversation. While Tokyo is really cool I suggest going to the smaller towns

Dominican republic (minus the current issues there) and Barbados gave me a feeling of safety. In D.R. I met the friendliest ppl i have ever met in any country so far. In Barbados you can catch a local public transportation bus and move around just like the locals. I would go back to both countries solo  (once the current D.R. issues are addressed).

These are some great suggestions. I live in the New England area and have also done much traveling, but only recently solo. I‚Äôd like to ad that those who want to travel and experience a totally different culture from the US that is easily accessible and muncher cheaper than the above mentioned destinations, look no further than Quebec, Canada. I have been there twice and I feel like there is so much more to explore. First off, Canadians are very friendly by nature, and if you can‚Äôt speak any French, but at least make an effort to say Bon jour or merci, you will be met with the utmost respect ( most speak English in the urban areas). Montreal and Quebec City both have their modern areas, but when you go into the Vieux Carre, or Old city areas, it is like stepping into a a quaint European city with tons of history. Also, for nature lovers, there is skiing in the Winter, whales in the Summertime; for a couple examples....there is just too much to mention all in this brief comment; you have to go and google this amazing area. Did I mention, the US dollar is worth a bit more than the Canadian dollar.... but for how long? Also, I believe you can cross the border with a pass card which is easier to get than the traditional passport. So go on and explore. Your very welcome üòä‚ù§Ô∏è

Ladies you need to consider Japan as well!! I went by myself when I was 19 for 5 weeks and it was the best thing I could‚Äôve done (: I felt more safe there than I do in my neighborhood. Definitely check it out!

I love this video but a white woman traveling to New Zealand, Ireland, Switzerland, Italy, etc, and an Asian to South Korea, and a Latina passing woman to Belize is awesome but I‚Äôd personally only take their word for the black women in this video as a BLACK woman, I know I sound pessimistic but traveling as a woman and a black woman is a whole different experience. I love all of your courage and this really inspired me. I just wanted to share that as a black woman who‚Äôs traveled a lot herself.

@Samsam  as an Asian I had a very bad experience in Istanbul.  People at the airport when you asked questions are very rude and most of the times gives you the wrong directions.  I was window shopping and this blond lady was following me and told me in a rude was not to touch the glass.  I scooted out of there in a hurry.  I will never go there again.
Samsam im so sorry u had to experience that. It‚Äôs so disgusting

I absolutely agree with you, like the lady talking about Ireland, I connected flights there and I the airport staff were hella rude. I'm not sure if its because I am a black woman but I definitely wouldn't book a trip there. Also, my mom lived in Switzerland and she's always mentioned that the Swiss are rude and not welcoming. Don't get me started on the Dominican republic especially with all the deaths that have occurred there, no ma'am. I will vouch for Thailand though, people are super friendly and hospitable.
Sorry to hear that. People suck sometimes....

I agree, but I've faced discrimination in my home country of America. Being Black, it should not be expected but you should also not take it personally.¬†

Agree 100% for Switzerland and Korea! (And portugal and italia) Switzerland is so peaceful at night, I am really really scared to be alone at night I‚Äôve been harassed multiple time like 99% of girls in this worls and it terrifies me, I went there this winter and it was beautiful you will really feel good there,
Now, my favorite Korea! I went in Korea for 3 weeks with my bf and it was magical I really found myself there people are adorable, food is amaziiiiing and cheap, airbnb‚Äôs are cheap, clothes and makeup are cheap, and there is sooo much to discover! Because it‚Äôs a small country you can visit a lot of cities by bus and not only staying in Seoul, I‚Äôve been to Jeju island which I love sooooo much, U-do island a little island nearby Jeju, Gyeongju is the city to learn about culture and it‚Äôs beautiful! Busan is the second biggest city in korea and it‚Äôs really great if you love clubbing and people are really friendly!
And because I love so much Korea I will go for my first time alone for 3 weeks!!

I take my tripod with me everywhere I go. I have a gorilla pod for my small camera, a bigger tripod for my main camera, a tiny tripod for my phone and I also have a goat cover for my phone so I can stick that to many surfaces. English is the international language, the only country I have had some trouble with language was Ukraine, but I used the translator on my phone and it turned out fine.
